title: ECB leaves monetary policy unchanged in Draghi's final meeting
text: The European Central Bank, as expected, left interest rates and other key elements of its monetary policy unchanged Thursday. The Frankfurt-based ECB said its Governing Council left the interest rate on its deposit facility at negative 0.5%, while its main lending rate remains at 0%. The ECB repeated that it expects to keep rates at "present or lower levels" until inflation, which has remained stubbornly low, "robustly" converges with its target of near but just below 2%. The ECB last month announced the controversial restart of its asset-buying program, which had previously been wound down last December. The ECB will begin buying assets at a pace of 20 billion euros a month beginning in November. Thursday's meeting was the final policy gathering overseen by ECB President Mario Draghi, whose nonrenewwable eight-year term ends on Oct. 31. Draghi, who will be succeeded by Christine Lagarde, the former head of the International Monetary Fund, will hold a post-meeting news conference at 8:30 a.m. Eastern.
